text.p: The Albanian Football Association (AFA) was reinstated by FIFA, world soccer's governing body, on Tuesday, clearing the way for a World Cup qualifying match against Northern Ireland to go ahead.
FIFA had suspended Albania indefinitely after the sports ministry ordered the suspension of the AFA's general secretary Eduard Dervishi and dissolved its executive committee.
Albanian sports secretary Marjeta Pronjari said Dervishi had broken the country's civil law by consistently postponing new executive committee elections.
FIFA, however, did not recognise the AFA's actions and suspended Albania, throwing into jeopardy the group nine World Cup qualifier against Northern Ireland on December 14.
Under pressure from FIFA, the AFA later reversed its decision to suspend Dervishi.
